epoetics.core

Class SimilarityFunctions

  • java.lang.Object
    • epoetics.core.SimilarityFunctions

  • public class SimilarityFunctions
extends java.lang.Object
    This class contains functions for computing the similarity between texts and functions for computing keyword-sets in the form of tag clouds from arbitrary levels of the linguistic and conceptual hierarchy.
    Author:
    Andreas Müller

    • Method Detail

      • computeVectors

        public static java.util.ArrayList<java.util.HashMap<java.lang.String,java.lang.Double>> computeVectors(java.lang.String doc_1,
                                                                                       java.lang.String doc_2)
        This method computes a vector from each string where everything between two whitespaces is taken as a term. In the HashMap which is computed each term in a string is a key and its frequency is its value.

      • cosineSimilarity

        public static double cosineSimilarity(java.util.HashMap<java.lang.String,java.lang.Double> doc_1_map,
                      java.util.HashMap<java.lang.String,java.lang.Double> doc_2_map)
        This method takes two vectors as input and returns their cosine similarity.

      • dotProduct

        public static double dotProduct(java.util.HashMap<java.lang.String,java.lang.Double> doc_1_map,
                java.util.HashMap<java.lang.String,java.lang.Double> doc_2_map)
        This method computes the dot product of two vectors. The vectors are usually vectors which map terms to some measure of the importance of a term in a document, e.g., term frequency or TFxIDF.

        public static float JaccardCoefficient(java.lang.String text_1,
                       java.lang.String text_2)
        This method takes two strings as input, tokenizes them using the regular expression [,;.: ] and returns the jaccard coefficient between the resulting sets of terms representing the two strings.

      • normalizationFactor

        public static double normalizationFactor(java.util.HashMap<java.lang.String,java.lang.Double> doc_1_map,
                         java.util.HashMap<java.lang.String,java.lang.Double> doc_2_map)
        This method computes the normalization factor for length normalization of vectors in the TFxIDF computation. See the book "Introduction to Information Retrieval", chapter 6, section "Queries as vectors", formula 27 (online edition).
